cold_snaps.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no cold snap in progress.  So far, 6 cold snaps have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 3.7.

extreme.status: The highest recorded temperature difference is 26.7°C from 29 April 2025 (when the temperature reached 27.1°C but fell to 0.4°C).

heatwave.status: There is currently no heatwave.  This year there have been 6 heatwaves, usually there are 1.9 heatwaves per year.

heaviest_rainfall.status: 36.8mm of rain was recorded as having fallen on 04 January 2025, marking an exceptional 37.2 hour precipitation event.  At times the rain was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: There was a torrential downpour today where the rain reached a maximum intensity of 16.6mm per hour (ranked 2nd in our records).  The storm lasted 3.2 hours and 5.69mm of precipitation fell during that time.  The heaviest rain was recorded on 02 September 2025 with a peak rate of 27.0mm per hour.  The storm lasted 15.0 hours and had a total rainfall of 21.19mm.

storm.status: On 04 January 2025, the rain lasted for 37.2 hours, which is the longest time recorded by our database.  36.8mm accumulated and it fell at 4.6mm per hour at times.
There is a storm around.  It's the first significant stormy weather event since 03 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: We are in the midst of one of the longest rainy periods recorded.  This rainy period is ranked 4th since records began in August 2024.  The current stretch started on 26 August 2025 and has lasted 10 days.  The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

tropical: The previous tropical night was on 18 July 2025, with only 62 in total since 1973.

average.status: The current wind direction is southerly (202°), which is about average.  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The top recorded wind gust is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The record wind run remains at 1754 miles from 21 October 2012.  The long-term average wind run is 229.41 miles and so far today the wind run is 65.73 miles.

speed.status: The top recorded wind speed is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 2.1°C) and drier conditions in outside humidity (down 7%) and rainfall (down 1.2 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in pressure (down 8 mbar) and rainfall (up 1.2 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in rainfall (down 0.1 mm), feels like temperature (up 2.1°C), outside temperature (up 1.7°C), and cloud levels (up 866 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 629.7m higher than yesterday, 210.8m higher than the past week, 865.6m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 565m to a maximum of 1838m, averaging 1740.2m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 1529.4m and 2610m respectively.

summary.summary: Inside; temperatures should be quite comfortable. Outside; the temperature will feel nicely warm and pleasant. Also, air moisture should feel ok and calm and still conditions are expected. Light to moderate rain is forecast, mostly clear skies with high cloud, and strong and powerful sunlight. Changeable conditions.
